StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Genome-Wide Association Study of Interventional Responses in the Heart Healthy Lenoir Study

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: These data are from subjects enrolled in the Heart Healthy Lenoir study (NCT01433484) that also opted into the genetics portion of the study. Two interventions were offered in the Heart Healthy Lenoir study, and subjects were allowed to enroll in either a single intervention or both. The lifestyle intervention is described by Keyserling et al. (PMID: 27495295) and the hypertension intervention is described by Halladay et al. (PMID: 27776790). Additional information regarding the study population and genomic research can be found in Skinner et al. (PMID: 25938669). The study was funded through the National Institutes of Health (NIH), National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI) grant P50 HL105184 and was made possible through the collaborations between the following Principal Investigators involved in the study: Jonathan C. Schisler, Cam Patterson, Thomas C Keyserling, Allice Ammerman, Darren DeWalt, and Jacqueline R. Halladay.
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution did not respond within six months)
